data.title: Bruce Willis fans in tears over 'best movie he ever made' that's been forgotten
data.meta_description: Bruce Willis fans have been left in tears after discovering one of the actor's lesser known films, with some branding the noughties movies, added to Netflix a 'masterpiece'.
data.text:
Netflix lovers are crying over a Bruce Willis film they missed, saying it's one of his best.

The streaming platform recently released the 2003 Hollywood blockbuster, Tears of the Sun, with some fans calling it a "masterpiece".

In a Facebook group dedicated to Netflix, one fan wrote: "Best movie he ever made besides Armageddon and I wouldn't choose."

Another added: "I love this movie. [Yo], I cried the first time I watched it."

A third said: "A true movie love can never miss this masterpiece," while another boldly claimed: "Best action movie yet."

Read More: Elvis Presley knocked out 'step brother and left him on ground for 20 minutes'

Lots of fans shared that they cried when they saw it, while others called it "great" and some have seen it many times.

One person on Facebook shared: "This movie makes [me] cry like a baby."

The movie, Tears of the Sun, came out more than 20 years ago and it's about a team of U.S. Navy SEALs saving people in Nigeria.

DON'T MISS...

Soap star Jennifer Leak dead after battling rare neurological disease [DEATH]

Singer Duffy makes sudden return to social media years after kidnapping claims [NEWS]

Miriam Margolyes sparks Harry Potter cast feud after telling fans to 'grow up' [COMMENT]

Bruce Willis plays Lieutenant A. K. Waters and he leads his team into the jungle to save Dr Lena Fiore Kendricks, played by Monica Bellucci.

She's a U.S. citizen and she says she'll only leave with them if they also save 70 refugees.

Bruce Willis, known for his role as John McClane in the Die Hard series, has had a long and successful career in Hollywood.

He's starred in many action films like Pulp Fiction, The Fifth Element, Armageddon, Red, Glass and Unbreakable.

Bruce also showed his range with a role in the horror-mystery film The Sixth Sense.

However, in recent years, his health has taken a turn for the worse.

The Die Hard star was diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia in 2023 with the news being announced by his family, leaving fans all over the world devastated.
